Reviews.Title: “Cozy and clean Inn”
Reviews.Author: Carol34859
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in July 2011 while visiting my son. It's not fancy, but it is very cozy and clean. It is located in a great area downtown within walking distance of just about everything. The staff were extrememly friendly and gave me a free upgrade to a larger room. The breakfast was very good, there is a guest laundry and a business center which was nice to have. Enjoyed my stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Charles C
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute business trip, and my friends recommended hotels were full. I booked this hotel as it was fairly close to downtown. I was pleasantly suprised. The room was very clean, spacious, fast internet for work in the evenings. The young family that runs it was very nice and even invited me in for tea one evening. I'm from western Colorado and I travel a LOT, so I was expecting much less for a budget hotel. Everything worked and the iron and ironing board was the nicest i've used in years at a hotel. Had some great discussions with some artists and laborers that were guests. I think I might have been the only one there that owned a tie. :) $5 taxi to convention center and all the bistros/pubs and Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs alert!!!!”
Reviews.Author: P L
Reviews.Content: San Diego is a nice place. My girl friend was excited to stay in this place with oversea visitors in late Oct. On the second day, one of them found many large bumps like mosquito bites on the upper body and arms. They didn't know what that were so they continued the stay. After my friend flied back, similar symptoms happened to her. It was very itchy for several days with no sign of getting better. We went to see a doctor who told us they look like bug bites. As I am writing this review, my friend still suffers the problem. If you want to choose this place, beware what may happen to you and your love ones. If you carry the bugs back home, you will be in even bigger trouble since the bugs might infest the entire house.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: haras_11
Reviews.Content: This place was ok. Not great. Not bad. Just ok. The bus stop is right outside so that was good as we didnt have a car. Not much to do in the area at all. Our room was fine and clean. The breakfast was a let down. The female working reception was helpful, but the male the next day was useless. We asked him to book a taxi for us for the next morning as we had to leave extreamly early to catch our train. We woke the next day to find he'd messed it up and we had no taxi and got no apology from him. He couldn't care less, and needs to work on his customer service. The vending machine was messed up, put my money in and selected a coke and got sprite. Then when my friend put his money in and selected sprite he got something completely different. Not cool. As i said, it was fine but nothing special and i wont be back

Reviews.Title: “Ghetto”
Reviews.Author: Passthetest
Reviews.Content: Me and two friends stayed here for a convention. We were told it was in walking distance, but quickly decided that we would not be walking. There really isn't easy access to much unless u drive or take a cab. The rooms are old and dingy. Even though the maids seemed nice and came in each day. We had a big ant problem the whole time we were there. Honestly we didn't spend much time at the room unless we were sleeping... But we kept the door double locked while we were in there. If you are looking for cheap and don't care, this hotel will do. If u are looking for comfort or clean, book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Debnath M
Reviews.Content: America's Best Value Inn at Downtown/Convention Center in San Diego has a good location - it is close to the Convention Center and other hotels where conferences are held. The rooms are neat and clean. The staff is polite and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings....”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryHolidaykid
Reviews.Content: Not in a great location...not near the convention centre or really anything. We walked back from the Pier...was a very long ways. Bus stops right out front and you can ride it all day for $1.50, so not a big deal. Hotel is ok, you get what you pay for. Lobby is small and smelled like pea! Really smelled like pea and other guests commented. By morning the staff was burning incense in the lobby? Flowery pea was now the odor. Breakfast is offered here, very small, and after the smell, we moved on to eat. Staff was friendly and accomodating as we arrived early. Room was clean and very roomy. Nothing over the top but had a nice sitting area, sink, fridge, microwave and large clean bathroom. Hotel is located in a fairly quite area just off the main freeway, very easy to get to. Overall a decent hotel for the price and being fairly downtown San Diego. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel For Comicon? Search for better.”
Reviews.Author: SarahCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I went to san Diego for Comicon and this was one of the last rooms available in town. The pros: It was a room, it had two queen beds, no bedbugs or vermin, it was mostly clean except for some water damage to the carpet by the bathroom ( a leak under the wall apparently) and fairly quiet. The cons: The reason it is fairly quiet is that it is the middle of Nowhere. No restaurants, clubs, bars, stores, movie theaters....nothing near this place to do at night. It is about a 15 min walk to the convention center. The hotel is not near any shuttles- it would take you as long to walk to a shuttle stop as to just walk to the Con. The neighborhood that the hotel is situated in is NOT one in which you want to be walking after dark. It is industrial, near the shipyard, empty buildings after 5pm, and streets filled with homeless encampments. The week of Comicon, the owner tried to boost my payment for my reserved room from $150.00 per night to $300 per night by telling me that my reservation fell through and the only rooms left were now $300. I booked through Venere.com and either they didnt send my cc# to him, or he claims they didnt. Either way, there was much arguing and contacting of Corporate HQs, and threatening emails. Finally he agreed to give me my booking back at $200 a night, still $50 more per night than what I had agreed to pay, but he had me over a barrel, no more rooms in town at any price, and he knew it. (If there was no convention in town, and you had choices, you would not pay more than $75 tops for this very basic room.) So, when you book, make sure you get written confirmation from the HOTEL, not just the booking consolidator. This hotel offers free danishes and coffee in the lobby in the am. But, at Beardsley & Newton, a couple of blocks from the hotel, there is a great little Mexican restaurant, New Mexico Cafe La Dona with really good breakfasts for about $7 per. If you do stay at this hotel and do walk, go there for brekky or take-along instead of paying through the nose for food around the CC. In the final analysis I would say: if you are planning for next year's Con, get a shuttle map (San Diego tourist info should have one) and find a hotel that is within the Convention's shuttle radius. It will make a huge difference in your ability to get to and from the CC easily and cheaply. (Parking at Petco Park is about $25.00 a day, and at the Marriot next door to the CC is $35).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rakesh74
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect and major bussiness centres (downtown) are at walkable distance (1-2miles). Rooms are well furnished and toilets are clean. The hotel staffs are very humble.

Reviews.Title: “We really did love it - just a great place”
Reviews.Author: bkm2774
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the West Park Inn ( America's Best Value Inn) 1840 4th Ave San Diego Ca this Jun 11th and 21st - it is a hidden treasure within a 20min walk from the Convention Center & downtown activities - or a $6.00 cab ride . A great value and the staff are absolutely great & so very helpful. The center court yard is full of palm trees and ferns - just beautiful. Rooms are European sized, clean and efficient. I will absolutely stay there again, when in San Diego - a great deal to say the least. B Murphy Fredericksburg, TX

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest with credit card number”
Reviews.Author: HonestProfessor
Reviews.Content: I called to reserve a room for a meeting two months away. I had to cancel the reservation more than a month before the trip was to occur. I called to cancel and they wrote a cancel note to the manager but I could not get cancelation number. Two weeks later I called again to say I never got the number. I got the same story, that they would cancel but the number would be forthcoming. I never went to the hotel. The hotel billed me for a nights stay 6 months after originally scheduled date that had been canceled. Credit card company no help because I could not prove I had called. BE CAREFUL DEALING WITH THIS HOTEL! DON"T HOLD A ROOM WITH A CREDIT CARD. It cost me over $100 and I never went there and tried twice to cancel well before the 24 hour date.

Reviews.Title: “Location ideal, Not Luxury, but great bang for the Buck, will do over!”
Reviews.Author: hiho64
Reviews.Content: Location as to the Gas Lamp district/Horton Plaza Mall about 6 blocks down hill, cab runs you about $5. each way. We used our AAA card and got a Fabulous Rate, on our room. We were shocked! the rooms are small but all you need is there, nice big TV, micro, fridge, nice bathroom and comfy full size bed (perfect for cuddling :)) Very Clean! Continental breakfast in the morning a plus. Parking is street parking and found it to be great since its free between 6pm - 8 am on weekdays and no metering on weekends. Didn't see any children running around. Most guests we saw, i would say are in there mid 20-40's . There are i believe 3 floors elevators available. Staff was pleasant. I would def do over. unless i was planning a indoor getaway, which i would never ever do in San Diego :)

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Greatstay1801
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the motel for a few days and had a great time and experience there. The location was close to all amenities and was close to the downtown core and it's attractions. The rooms were very nice and comfy, and we found them to be very clean. The service was friendly and hospitable and we had no problems while staying here. The prices were reasonable and we had an overall great time.We highly recommend this motel for everyone in need of a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Giboze
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just down the street from a friend's place which is why I chose it, and right off the freeway. It was quiet (for a city hotel) and the rooms and outside areas were very clean. The room was small but the beds were comfortable and the hotel staff very accommodating. The parking was very tight, but there may have been more spaces in the back. I liked little touches like the microwave, refrigerator, hand lotion packets, and safe. I would definitely recommend it to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with safe parking, Helpful staff, Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: take73one
Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise. This property is so convenient to convention center and downtown. Easy access to 5 fwy, restaurants and Ocean attractions. The staff is so helpful. One of the few Inns that have their own onsite free parking close to your room.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zeppy12
Reviews.Content: Myself and two other friends stayed here for three nights. One of my friends had big red welt looking spots all over his back, chest, arms, legs, and face! We first thought he had an allergic reaction to something he ate, until a couple of days later I had the same thing. We slept in different beds so the whole room was infested. This is worse than ant and mosquito bites, it's been over a week since we've been back and we are still suffering.

Reviews.Title: “Typical motel”
Reviews.Author: gch104
Reviews.Content: Typical motel - they are generally not the best hotels in the world but are not claiming to be! I did not see any bugs and our air con worked fine. Did have problems with the safe and hairdryer but they said we could change rooms if we wanted. We had internet in our room and cereal/croissants for breakfast. Our room also had a fridge and microwave. Traffic noise bothered my family a little as we were on the road side, but there were quieter rooms available, and too be honest I always wear earplugs anyway. The hotel is very close to the convention center and downtown but not in the best area (hence being cheap). Is fine if you have a car but would not recommend walking on your own in the area late at night as there are quite a few homeless people along the main route to downtown. I had to attend a conference at the SD Conference centre and it took approx 5-10 mins to drive there and is around the same to Horton Plaza. If you go thinking that it is a motel then it is fine, if you expect a 3 star hotel then you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Budget - Yes; Remotely Nice - No”
Reviews.Author: Captaincpr
Reviews.Content: To give you an idea of how BAD it is, while I was checking in 2 people came to the office and gave their keys back and said they couldn't stay there! I should have followed their lead! I'm pretty adventurous, so I checked-in anyway. One positive was that the manager was very nice. The hotel is sketchy to begin with, so when the carpets were gross and there was lots of mold in the bathrooms, and the beds were basically broken, I shouldn't have been suprised. This is not the place to stay!!! Don't do it unless you want cheap and DIRTY!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a motel. You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: walchris
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for classy this is not the place for you! We are 3 girls in our late 20's who felt safe staying there and would again if the occasion arose. Two of our other friends decided this place wasn't for them and got a room somewhere else. We were here for street scene as most of the other guests were also. When i looked for hotels in the area this one was 100 bucks cheaper than the rest. Right there it should tell you the quality of the place. Our room did have that cleaning smell, saw no bugs, the airconditioned worked fine, coffee in the room was good, staff was friendly, didn't see any drug dealers, and the place was quite. Yes you are in the ghetto but we fealt fine walking down the streets during the day to the downtown area but took $6 taxi rides back to the hotel at night. If you do stay here try the Juice/Smoothie place on National. If you are there because of a timeshare pay the extra 10 bucks for a better place. It is only 10 bucks!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Disgusting Place Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: SUPERMUDA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to timeshare presentation and they promised us a nice hotel in San Diego. Stupid me I thought it would be nice since they usually send you to nice places. The Lobby smells like urine, I woke up in the middle of night to find roaches all over my travel bag. There were drug dealers next door up all night with people coming in and out. What ever you do STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. After the first night we changed hotels. Just Disgusting!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: ilcatz
Reviews.Content: I read previous reviews, but had absolutely no problems with noise, crime or residents in the neighborhood. The room was very basic, clean, and shabby, but for the price it was what I expected. Keep in mind that you are in a poor neighborhood and be mindful of safety, especially after dark. The best thing about this location is that it is right off the 5 freeway so it is easy to get to, it is right outside of downtown San Diego, and the staff is very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “All of these Reviews are Correct!!”
Reviews.Author: XTRASASSY
Reviews.Content: I too, am a victim of a 2 hour Timeshare presentation, which got me booked in this typically bad motel. First, I would like to say that some of these concerns were not the motels fault. For example, the city decided to jack-hammer the street at 7:30 am. The garbage collection was prompt at 8 am. These things were unfortunate. On the flip side, the toilet had a mind of its own, the bathroom fan did not work, I can't tell you what an experience that was at times. In the middle of the night the smoke alarm started beeping repeatedly. The area set up for the coffee pot, was like that old show Green Acres, where you could only have certain things plugged in at one time, not to mention the outlet itself was falling out of the wall. The mattress was higher on one side, than the other. Lastly the continental breakfast was not kept stocked - except for the gallon of milk that was not on ice. Then there is the location. Right off of the freeway, convenient. Just a block away from the Barrio. And if you are looking for any fast food places, forget it. Overall I would say, for FREE, it was OK. To actually pay money to stay there.....I DON'T THINK SO.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected *What do you expect for FREE?”
Reviews.Author: nukefish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did a timeshare presentation and stayed here because it was free. We had low expectations of the place because of the reviews. It was better than we expected. It is true that it is not located in a good area of San Diego, but I felt safe and the parking lot was well lit. There are some parking spaces that are way too small, but others that are fine. Our heater/air conditioner did not turn off so it was unplugged when we got in the room. I quickly found the problem and pluged it in. The TV was set on a low dresser so I put it up on the table. The room had a small microwave and a fridge. There were signs of rust and abit of mildew in the bathroom, but overall it was clean. It did have a strong cleaning solution smell when we entered but it wasn't overwhelming and you quickly got used to it. The room we were in had a couch, so that was nice. The toilet didn't flush that great, but we just held the handle down and it was fine. I am glad that we didn't do the timeshare upgrade of 70 bucks to a holiday inn. There was muffins/pastries, juice, cereal, coffee, and milk in the morning. The milk was just sitting out, so I would be a bit wary of that. Overall it was a good value for us (being that we paid 13 dollars in taxes only). There was construction next door that started around 7am, but it didn't bother us much. I would recommend this place for a cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ghengisjon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before reading the reviews online and was a little apprehensive after hearing of other people's bad experiences. But after I arrived at the hotel I had trouble understanding what all the fuss was about. The hotel was clean and quite, the staff friendly and the rooms had plenty of amenities. It was on a busy bus route, taxi's were relatively cheap and the 20 minute walk to downtown was not bad at all. I've paid a lot more to stay in far worse! Now obviously this is not downtown San Diego and perhaps that's what scares some people. But stories of pimps and drug dealers just smack of racism. In my opinion you get a far more accurate view of the city and culture than if you stayed in one of the big hotels downtown. Besides, the best authentic Mexican restaurant around is 2 blocks away and if you walk a few more blocks you can hop on a streetcar and be at the Mexican border in 20 minutes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very confortable place”
Reviews.Author: MIA99
Reviews.Content: I heard from my nephew that this was a very bad hotel and that the area was bad too. When I arrived to the hotel it seem nice to me and when we chek inn the front desk was very nice and explain how to use the public transportation around. It was all good, close to transportation, stores close by and continental breakfast in the morning. Going towards downtown there are too many homeless around there but " what can the hotel do" nothing because its "public transportation and street is free. So I know that we dont like to see all this things going on but remember that we never know when or where you will see something you don't like or even dangerous. Even in the best part of the world all this things happen. The rooms are super clean and whats best is that the convention is only 1 mile and gaslam quarter-downtown 2 1/2 miles. very close for a very convinience price. I was very confortable all this time I stay there as a senior I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UT_gb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only for the most hearty and cheapest of people. My wife vomited from the smell as soon as I unlocked the door. She couldn't go into the office because of the smell. We didn't dare eat the "continental breakfast." The previous "guest" had left items in our room which were not cleaned out by the maid. It's in a scary neighborhood where everything has bars on the windows. They do have wireless but I was scared to leave my lap top in the room unattended. With that said, it is close to the freeway and the bus to downtown. PLEASE be warned, you'd be better off spending more money and staying someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: iandel
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this place are actually not too bad - quite big, comfortable bed, decent air-con and good shower. The problem is, it's located in a ghetto with people sleeping rough all over the place. We took a 10 min walk to the train on 12th at around 6 pm and did not feel safe at all. And, you definitely would not walk around there after dark. We also had to wait over an hour to get a cab to take us into town one of the nights. If frugality is your only concern, this might be for you, but I would strongly recommend paying that bit extra to stay in a nicer part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: butch-l
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews of this motel, I actually had a perverse interest in staying here, as long as I could view the previously described action from a distance. We spent two nights here courtesy of a time share presentation my partner endured several months ago, and I found this motel to be one of the quietest I can remember staying in. Our room had minimal amenities, but was clean. This is obviously a motel whose time has come and gone, but they do seem to be making a reasonable effort to keep it habitable. The parking lot is way to busy for the amount of business the motel seems to be doing, and I expect there's still a fair amount of illicit business being done there, but it had no effect on our stay. I would definitely NOT recommend any after dark strolls in this neighborhood, as it borders or the edge of downtown and a large homeless facility is a few blocks away. We walked around the area during the day and encountered no problems. You can walk into downtown San Diego in about 15 minutes if you're so inclined. There are also two bus lines running on Logan Avenue with stops either in front of the motel or on the next corner. If you're coming by car, there is freeway access literally at your front door. I wouldn't reccommend bringing the kids here for a fun filled family vacation, but if you're looking for a place to stay on the cheap, this place should do. A conversation with the manager here, who is apparently fairly new, indicated that the previous management "may have been catering to a little different clientele." He appears to be doing a good job of turning things around, although this place isn't all the way back to respectability yet. We stayed on the back side of the motel, which helped cut down on freeway and parking lot noise. If you can get a room here for about sixty bucks or less, it's an okay place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “keep looking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are doing case studies on the habits of nocturnal street people, by all means stay here. If you want safety, get far away from this dive. I wished I had read the previous reviews before staying there. Went to San Diego to attend a ballgame at Petco park and all I knew was that this place was within walking distance. When the game let out about 10:30 p.m. (10 innings) we started walking and got lost. I asked a Police officer for directions to the hotel and his response was "why are you staying there?" I felt embarrased for not doing the research before booking. In the middle of the night when the blood curdling screams around the corner woke me, I almost got dressed and left. I am a former deputy sheriff and this place scared me. SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! KEEP LOOKING!!! A little p.s. the lobby smelled of urine when we walked in. yuk!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the love of God...Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received a free trip to San Diego for going to a "45 minute timeshare pitch". We declined to pay the $100.00 to upgrade to a better motel because neither of us had ever been to San Diego and didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. WHAT A MISTAKE THAT WAS!!! The room itself wasn't bad but the area was terrible. I read the two reviews that were posted previously and thought, "How bad can it really be?" It's by far the worst place I've ever stayed at and I've stayed in some real dumps!! Upon arrival, we almost mowed down two people presumably making a drug deal right in the parking lot. They didn't seem to care that we had to wait for them to make the exchange. The dealer even accidently dropped the baggie on the ground, picked it up and finished his business! We went out for the evening and got back to the room quite late. This is when everyone that lives there (pay by the week?) just starts getting active!! And I'm not just talking about the partying back and forth between rooms and on the balcony's. Cars would pull up at all hours, tap on their horn, and then someone would run out to the car and give them "whatever" and 20 seconds later they'd drive off. And the hookers!!! You could hear them yelling and the "clip-clop" of their high heeled shoes all night. I finally got up and put a towel under the door because it had about a one inch gap underneath and that kept some of the noise out. We laugh about this now....but it made for two really miserable sleepless nights!! Moral of the story....UPGRADE!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Like The Plague!”
Reviews.Author: raukj
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention in San Diego last summer & make the collossal mistake of staying in this horrific dive in the bario and it ruined my week. First they "lost" my reservation and it was implied that I may have to pay extra for a room at so short notice. I stood my ground & got my crappy room. I saw cars pulling up outside my room all night, one guy would get out & run up into one of the rooms while his partner waited. He'd get "something" & be back out in the car in 2 or 3 minutes & off they'd go. Hooker's patrolling by all night. It's right off the freeway ramp with a chain-link covered walkover that's all graffiti & broken glass. I had to walk 3 blocks to a trolly station & stand amongst the bums to catch a trolly. I preferred to walk, though it took 35 minutes to get to the convention center. I actually passed a bag lady having sex under a blanket with some drunk right by her shopping cart between the curb and a chainlink fence on Industry Blvd. at 7:15am, with cars whizzing by. I have never seen such a epidemic of homeless people like in the San Diego industrial district right next to the bario the hotel's in. I was told that the mild climate draws them from all over. I dreaded returning to the hotel & kept myself locked up in my room till the next morning. DON'T STAY THERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES - YOU WILL BE MORTIFIED IF YOU DO. IT WAS THE WORST PLACE I'VE EVER STAYED & UNFORTUNATELY I CAN'T EVER FORGET IT NO MATTER HOW MUCH I WOULD LOVE TO.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here--Period”
Reviews.Author: MJ12ONE
Reviews.Content: I rode the Amtrak to San Diego from LA, since San Diego has an excellent trolley system. I called the hotel to ask which trolley to take to get to the hotel. The desk clerk told me that the trolley stop was 2 blocks away, but since it was dark--he advised me to take a cab becuase of the neighborhood. I'm glad I took his advice. They lock the lobby at night and all transactions take place at a bulletproof window. When I was checking in a pimp and 3 of his girls were waiting to check in behind me. This place is out far away from everything and in an industrial area. The money I saved on hotel rate--I ate up in cab fare. My advice--stay here only if you are hiding out.

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Inn-Convention Center/Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1801 Logan Ave., San Diego, CA 92113
